TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: mareḍava kati sa Kidadaw (Qatsiłay village, p.164)

S.FORM: uzai a mareḍava a maisuisu i vavaw tua qinałivan.
ozai a maredrava a maisoiso i vavaw toa qinaljivan.
S.TRANSL: There were women friends pounding grain up on a roof.

S.FORM: manu łateku aravats a kalevelevan; saqetju aravats a qadaw.
mano ljateko aravac a kalevelevan; saqetjo aravac a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: The sky was very low, and the suns’ heat was very painful.

S.FORM: qau małavar azua mareḍava: "aku saqetju aravats a qadaw?
qao maljavar azoa maredrava: "ako saqetjo aravac a qadaw?
S.TRANSL: The women said to one another: “Why is the suns’ heat very painful?

S.FORM: paulan tu tja tsektseken tua qaselu," aya matsidił.
paolan to tja cekceken toa qaselo," aya macidilj.
S.TRANSL: There’s the danger of our striking them with our pestles,” said one.

S.FORM: mintu sipalut a tsemektsek.
minto sipalot a cemekcek.
S.TRANSL: Then they really did strike them,

S.FORM: qau mavutsanga a qadaw a ita.
qao mavocanga a qadaw a ita.
S.TRANSL: and one sun went blind.

S.FORM: avan anga azua qiłas.
avan anga azoa qiljas.
S.TRANSL: That is now the moon.

S.FORM: qau tsalugtsug anga a kalevelevan a łevavaw.
qao calogcog anga a kalevelevan a ljevavaw.
S.TRANSL: And with a bump the sky went up.

S.FORM: manu zemaing ti sa Kidadaw.
mano zemaing ti sa Kidadaw.
S.TRANSL: Then Kidadaw cried out.

S.FORM: qau marekutj a mareḍava.
qao marekotj a maredrava.
S.TRANSL: The women friends were afraid,

S.FORM: qau mavilad a mareḍava a sema pasa likuz tua vaqu.
qao mavilad a maredrava a sema pasa likoz toa vaqo.
S.TRANSL: and ran away and hid behind the millet (store).

S.FORM: łakua laingen ni sa Kidadaw; sa djameqi sa patsasavi.
ljakoa laingen ni sa Kidadaw; sa djameqi sa pacasavi.
S.TRANSL: But Kidadaw chased them, and caught (one) and brought her outside.

S.FORM: qau kiłavaran ti sa Kidadaw: "qiladju tua tataqan.
qao kiljavaran ti sa Kidadaw: "qiladjo toa tataqan.
S.TRANSL: Kidadaw said: “Sit on the whetstone.

S.FORM: ku tsavulidaw sun," aya ti sa Kidadaw.
ko cavolidaw son," aya ti sa Kidadaw.
S.TRANSL: I’ll carry you on my shoulder,” he said.

S.FORM: "ini; marekutj aken tua su djui," aya azua vavayan.
"ini; marekotj aken toa so djoi," aya azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: “No. I’m afraid of your spikes,” said the woman.

S.FORM: łakua pitsipitsen sa paqiladji ni sa Kidadaw.
ljakoa picipicen sa paqiladji ni sa Kidadaw.
S.TRANSL: But Kidadaw got hold of her and made her sit down,

S.FORM: sa tsavulidi a pasa tjumaq tua tapaw ni sa Kidadaw, sa puvałavi anga.
sa cavolidi a pasa tjomaq toa tapaw ni sa Kidadaw, sa povaljavi anga.
S.TRANSL: and carried her into his house, and made her his wife.

S.FORM: qau tsuatsuay anga vaik a venateq.
qao coacoay anga vaik a venateq.
S.TRANSL: After a long time she went to wash clothes.

S.FORM: manu djumaken a tsiqaw a lialiaw.
mano djomaken a ciqaw a lialiaw.
S.TRANSL: She found a lot of fish.

S.FORM: qau djameqen nimadju, sa katsu-i a tjumaq; qau sa san djamay.
qao djameqen nimadjo, sa kaco-i a tjomaq; qao sa san djamay.
S.TRANSL: She caught them and took them home, and made a side dish of them.

S.FORM: qau maka kan tiamadju; mintu saqetju a tjiał.
qao maka kan tiamadjo; minto saqetjo a tjialj.
S.TRANSL: When they had finished eating, she had stomach ache.

S.FORM: qau nusauni, "pusaladji aken a putsaqi."
qao nosaoni, "posaladji aken a pocaqi."
S.TRANSL: Later she said: “Come with me while I go to defecate.”

S.FORM: inika tsuay uta, "pusaladji aken a putsaqi," aya azua vaław.
inika coay ota, "posaladji aken a pocaqi," aya azoa valjaw.
S.TRANSL: Soon afterwards, “Come with me while I go,” said the wife.

S.FORM: manu masupil anga ti sa Kidadaw.
mano masopil anga ti sa Kidadaw.
S.TRANSL: Kidadaw got tired of this.

S.FORM: "matselaqut aken a vaik," aya ti sa Kidadaw.
"macelaqot aken a vaik," aya ti sa Kidadaw.
S.TRANSL: “I’m tired of going,” said Kidadaw.

S.FORM: qau vaik azua vavayan a matsidił sakamaya putsaqi.
qao vaik azoa vavayan a macidilj sakamaya pocaqi.
S.TRANSL: So the woman went off alone to defecate.

S.FORM: manu maka putsaqi azua vavayan.
mano maka pocaqi azoa vavayan.
S.TRANSL: When she had finished,

S.FORM: qau kiłavaranan a tsaqi nimadju: "nu qemaqivu ti sa Kidadaw, 'aa' aya-u anga," ayain a tsaqi.
qao kiljavaranan a caqi nimadjo: "no qemaqivo ti sa Kidadaw, 'aa' aya-o anga," ayain a caqi.
S.TRANSL: she said to the faeces: “When Kidadaw calls, say ‘Ah’,” she said.

S.FORM: qau timadju mavilad anga sema tjumaq.
qao timadjo mavilad anga sema tjomaq.
S.TRANSL: And she ran away back to her own home.

S.FORM: qau nu qemaqivu ti sa Kidadaw, "aa," aya azua tsaqi.
qao no qemaqivo ti sa Kidadaw, "aa," aya azoa caqi.
S.TRANSL: When Kidadaw called, the faeces said “Ah”.

S.FORM: nu qaqivuin uta, "aa," aya azua tsaqi.
no qaqivoin ota, "aa," aya azoa caqi.
S.TRANSL: When he called again, it said “Ah”.

S.FORM: qaqivuin anan uta.
qaqivoin anan ota.
S.TRANSL: He called once more,

S.FORM: "aa," aya uta a tsaqi.
"aa," aya ota a caqi.
S.TRANSL: and again it said “Ah”.

S.FORM: qau samałi ti sa Kidadaw.
qao samalji ti sa Kidadaw.
S.TRANSL: Kidadaw was surprised.

S.FORM: "makuda azua tsautsau?
"makoda azoa caocao?
S.TRANSL: “What’s happened to her?

S.FORM: aku tsuay anga aravats a inika pangtjengtjez?" aya timadju.
ako coay anga aravac a inika pangtjengtjez?" aya timadjo.
S.TRANSL: Why is she so long not coming back?” he said.

S.FORM: qau vaiken a kiqenetj.
qao vaiken a kiqenetj.
S.TRANSL: He went to have a look;

S.FORM: mintu avan anga tsaqi sakamaya.
minto avan anga caqi sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: and there was only the faeces.

S.FORM: qau limutseng ti sa Kidadaw; siqaqeḍu tua nimadju, sa pusapui a qatsiłay, a tsektsekan tua nimadju.
qao limoceng ti sa Kidadaw; siqaqedro toa nimadjo, sa posapoi a qaciljay, a cekcekan toa nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: Kidadaw was angry. With his penis in a state of erection he struck it against a stone and produced fire.
